content.value: This week, we finalized our project team for our 4th year Capstone project. Key activities:

items: Assigned roles and responsibilities for team members (Electrical, Software, Mechanical, and Controls Leads)
Discussed team goals and expectations (Time commitments)
Set up communication channels and tools (Discord)

content.value: Next steps: Define the problem and establish project requirements.
This week, we defined the problem and identified the need for our project. Highlights:

items: The problem determined was the lack of or inefficiencies in monitoring for hazards in factory environments
Researched industry requirements for safety monitoring robots
Outlined initial objectives and scope of the projects
Created our website!

content.value: Next steps: Discuss problem definition, constraints, and criteria.
We delved into the problem definition and established constraints and criteria for the project. Key outcomes:

items: Defined constraints such as budget, size, and materials
Set criteria for success including adaptability, coverage, top speed, and safety
Ideated about potential solutions and the preexisting ones

content.value: Next steps: Present potential solutions and explore existing patents.
This week, we presented potential solutions and reviewed existing patents. Key discussions:

items: Outlined 4 potential solutions that adress the problem of monitoring hazards in factories
Reviewed 3 existing patents related to similar technologies
Analyzed strengths and weaknesses of each solution and how we can leverage them in our design

content.value: Next steps: Select the best solution and move forward with design planning.
We selected the best solution for RoboWatch. Here's what we accomplished:

items: Evaluated potential solutions based on defined constraints and criteria
Developed a decision matrix with weighed criteria
Documented rationale for the selected solution, an autonomous mobile robot

content.value: Next steps: Prepare for the Preliminary Design Presentation (PDP).
This week, we presented our preliminary design for RoboWatch. Highlights of the PDP:

items: Shared initial 3D models and design sketches
Outlined functional requirements and key features
Gathered feedback from classmates and advisors about next steps

content.value: Next steps: Incorporate feedback and start working on the detailed design.
We developed a detailed design for RoboWatch this week. Key achievements:

items: Finalized prototype CAD models with precise dimensions
Selected key components, including sensors and motors
Drafted high level circuit diagrams for hardware integration
Researched vision language models capable of running on a Jetson Orin NX

content.value: Next steps: Perform design verification to test feasibility and functionality.
We verified the feasibility of our detailed design this week. Highlights:

items: Ran simulations (FEA, Model inference) to test hardware and software integration
Tested the vision language model's capabilities for live video captioning
Validated compliance with project constraints and criteria for the final report

content.value: Next steps: Prepare for the Final Design Presentation (FDP).
We delivered the Final Design Presentation (FDP) this week. Key points from the presentation:

items: Showcased finalized CAD models and design details
Showed off the detailed electrical schematics and component diagrams
Outlined the manufacturing and implementation plan
Showed off our testing of the vision langauge models!

content.value: Next steps: Submit the final report

title: Final Report and Design Log Update

content.value: We completed our final deliverables for the RoboWatch project. Key accomplishments:

items: Submitted the final project report detailing the design process and outcomes
Continued working on our prototype
Team dinner!

content.value: This concludes the design log for MTE 481, we'll see you again in MTE 482!

title: Jetson Further Configuration for GPU Setup

content.value: Advanced our Jetson configuration for optimized ML performance:

items: Installed updated CUDA drivers for better GPU utilization
Configured TensorRT for optimized inference
Conducted comprehensive ML model inference benchmarking
Optimized memory allocation for real-time processing
Tested power consumption under various workloads

content.value: Next steps: Integrate LIDAR mapping capabilities with the GPU-accelerated ML pipeline.
Made significant progress on LIDAR integration for our autonomous driving stack:

items: Developed point cloud processing algorithms
Implemented SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) functionality
Created obstacle detection and avoidance systems
Tested mapping accuracy in various environments
Optimized data processing for real-time operation

content.value: Next steps: Integrate mapping with path planning algorithms for complete autonomous navigation.
Advanced our CAD design for the Version 2 robot:

items: Introduced a scissor lift mechanism for the camera (so doesn't block lidar while mapping and can go up and down for turns and such)
Refined aesthetic elements for a professional appearance
Implemented larger and more robust chassis design
Improved cable management pathways
Optimized component placement for better weight distribution

content.alt: CAD progress showing V2 design without walls

content.value: Next steps: Finalize CAD design with complete wall integration and assembly details.
Completed the PCB design based on validated electrical architecture from V1:

items: Finalized schematic with all validated connections
Optimized component placement for thermal performance
Implemented proper ground planes and power distribution
Added dedicated headers for all subsystem connections
Conducted design rule checks and electrical validation
Submitted PCB order to manufacturer!

content.alt: PCB design sketch showing layout and connections

content.value: Next steps: Prepare for PCB assembly once boards arrive from manufacturer.
Major milestone: finalized CAD design for Version 2 robot is complete:

items: Completed all mechanical component designs
Verified assembly clearances and tolerances
Optimized for manufacturability with available equipment
Generated final production-ready drawings and models

content.alt: Final CAD model for Version 2 RoboWatch

content.value: Next steps: Begin manufacturing and component production. Most of the next entries will be in the build log :)
